item.title: Existence of a Solution in the Open Interval (0, 1) for a Cubic Equation with Real Coefficients
item.description:
Let $a,b,c\in \mathbb{R}$. Show that there exists $x\in (0,1)$ such that

$$4ax^3+3bx^2+2cx=a+b+c.$$

Show Hint:
Apply the Rolle's Theorem to the function $\varphi:[0,1]\to \mathbb{R}, t\mapsto at^4+bt^3+ct^2-(a+b+c)t$.

item.title: Non-Periodicity of a Differentiable Function with a Non-Vanishing Derivative
item.description:
Let $\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ be a differentiable function. Assume that $f’$ does not vanish. Show that $f$ cannot be periodic.

Show Answer:
If $f$ is $T$-periodic with $T>0$, then by applying Rolle's Theorem between, for example, 0 and $T$, the derivative of $f$ must vanish.
